oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper, the problem of illusory perception, as approached by the NyAya and Advaita VedAnta schools of philosophy, is discussed from the standpoint of the Parimala. This seminal work belonging to the BhAmatA << tradition of Advaita VedAnta was composed in the sixteenth century by the polymath Appaya DA << ka(1)ita pound. In the context of discussing various theories of illusion, DA << ka(1)ita pound dwells upon the NyAya theory of anyathAkhyAti, and its connection with jAnalaka(1)aa(1) pound double dagger apratyAsatti as a causal factor for perception, and closely examines if such an extraordinary (alaukika) perception is tenable to explain illusory perception. He then proceeds to point out the deficiencies of this model and thereby brings to the fore the anirvacanA << yakhyAti of Advaitins as the only theory which stands scrutiny.
